questions.text: Original: 'Had the committee not intervened promptly, the entire project would have collapsed irreversibly.'
options: Without the committee's prompt intervention, the project would have suffered irreversible collapse.
The committee's intervention prevented the project from collapsing, but it was too late.
If the committee had intervened later, the project would still have been saved.
The project collapsed because the committee failed to intervene in time.
questions.explanation: המשפט המקורי משתמש במבנה היפותטי הפוך (inverted conditional) עם 'Had + subject + not + past participle' המבטא תנאי בזמן עבר. המשמעות היא שההתערבות המהירה של הוועדה מנעה קריסה בלתי הפיכה של הפרויקט. אפשרות 1 משמרת את המשמעות הזו במדויק באמצעות 'Without' + שם עצם + תואר, ומציינת שללא ההתערבות המהירה הפרויקट היה קורס באופן בלתי הפיך. שאר האפשרויות משנות את המשמעות: אפשרות 2 מציעה שההתערבות הייתה מאוחרת מדי, אפשרות 3 מציעה שהתערבות מאוחרת יותר עדיין הייתה מצילה את הפרויקט, ואפשרות 4 טוענת שהפרויקט אכן קרס.
examples: Had she not studied hard, she would have failed the exam → Without her hard studying, she would have failed the exam.
Had they not arrived early, they would have missed the flight → Without their early arrival, they would have missed the flight.
questions.grammarRule: Inverted conditionals with 'Had + subject + not + past participle' can be restated using 'Without + possessive + noun/gerund' while maintaining the same hypothetical meaning about past events.
questions.commonMistakes: Students often confuse the timing and causality, thinking the negative outcome actually occurred, or misunderstanding that the intervention was successful in preventing the collapse.
questions.usageTip: When converting inverted conditionals, focus on the cause-effect relationship: what prevented what from happening, and maintain the hypothetical nature of the consequence.

questions.text: Original: 'Scarcely had the CEO announced the merger when stock prices began fluctuating wildly.'
options: The CEO had barely announced the merger before stock prices started fluctuating wildly.
After the CEO announced the merger, stock prices remained stable for a while.
Stock prices fluctuated wildly, so the CEO decided to announce the merger.
The CEO's merger announcement came long after stock prices began fluctuating.
questions.explanation: המשפט המקורי משתמש במבנה 'Scarcely had + subject + past participle + when' המבטא רצף מהיר של אירועים - כמעט מיד לאחר ההכרזה על המיזוג, מחירי המניות החלו להשתנות בפראות. אפשרות 1 משמרת את המשמעות הזו באמצעות 'barely...before' המבטאת את אותו רצף מהיר. המילה 'barely' שווה ערך ל-'scarcely' ו-'before' מתאימה ל-'when' בהקשר זה. אפשרות 2 טוענת שהמחירים נשארו יציבים זמן מה, אפשרות 3 הופכת את סדר הסיבה והתוצאה, ואפשרות 4 טוענת שההכרזה הגיעה הרבה אחרי תחילת התנודות. רק אפשרות 1 משמרת את הרצף המיידי והסיבתיות הנכונה.
examples: Scarcely had the rain started when everyone ran for shelter → Everyone had barely started running when the rain began.
Scarcely had the meeting begun when the fire alarm sounded → The meeting had barely begun before the fire alarm sounded.
questions.grammarRule: 'Scarcely had + subject + past participle + when' indicates immediate sequence and can be restated with 'barely/hardly + had + past participle + before/when' maintaining the same temporal relationship.
questions.commonMistakes: Students may reverse the cause-effect relationship or misunderstand that 'scarcely...when' indicates immediate sequence, not a delayed reaction.
questions.usageTip: Remember that 'scarcely/barely/hardly' all express the same idea of 'almost not' or 'just barely,' and the timing is crucial - the second event happens almost immediately after the first.

questions.text: Original: 'Not until the final audit was completed did the irregularities in the financial records come to light.'
options: The irregularities in the financial records only became apparent when the final audit was completed.
The final audit was completed before the irregularities were discovered.
Irregularities were found throughout the audit process, not just at the end.
The audit revealed irregularities that had been known about previously.
questions.explanation: המשפט המקורי משתמש במבנה היפוך עם 'Not until' הדורש היפוך של הפועל העזר והנושא. המשמעות היא שרק כאשר הביקורת הסופית הושלמה, התגלו הליקויים ברישומים הכספיים - לא לפני כן. אפשרות 1 משמרת את המשמעות הזו באמצעות 'only...when' המבטאת את אותו עיתוי מדויק - הליקויים התגלו רק בנקודת זמן ספציפית זו. המילה 'apparent' שווה ערך ל-'come to light' במשמעות של התגלות. אפשרות 2 מציעה שהליקויים התגלו לפני השלמת הביקורת, אפשרות 3 טוענת שהליקויים נמצאו לאורך כל התהליך, ואפשרות 4 מציעה שהליקויים היו ידועים מראש. רק אפשרות 1 משמרת את העיתוי המדויק והחדשנות של הגילוי.
examples: Not until midnight did the party end → The party only ended at midnight.
Not until she graduated did she realize her potential → She only realized her potential when she graduated.
questions.grammarRule: 'Not until + time/event + auxiliary verb + subject + main verb' can be restated using 'only + when/at + time/event' without inversion, maintaining the same temporal restriction.
questions.commonMistakes: Students often miss the precise timing aspect, thinking the discovery happened earlier or was gradual rather than occurring specifically at the moment the audit was completed.
questions.usageTip: Focus on the exclusivity of timing - 'not until' means 'only at that specific moment and not before,' so look for restatements that preserve this precise temporal boundary.
